abstract: Manhattan District Atty Cyrus R Vance will appeal Judge Eduardo Padro's decision to order new trial for Johnny Hincapie, Queens man convicted of taking part in 1990 murder of tourist Brian Watkins in New York subway; Hincapie's lawyer criticizes Vance for delaying trial that could exonerate his client, who has served 25 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney will appeal a judge’s decision to grant a new trial to Johnny Hincapie, who was released from prison last month on bail to await a second day in court.

headline.main: Retrial in ’90 Killing of Tourist on a New York Subway Platform Is Delayed
headline.print_headline: Retrial in ’90 Killing of Tourist Is Delayed

snippet: The Manhattan district attorney will appeal a judge’s decision to grant a new trial to Johnny Hincapie, who was released from prison last month on bail to await a second day in court.
